intro: Origanum membranaceum, commonly known as lemon thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, lemon-scented leaves and small, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage is often used in culinary applications and herbal remedies due to its distinctive fragrance and medicinal properties. Origanum membranaceum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
